fields.value: Basic socioeconomic data from the Metropolitan region of Rio de Janeiro in 2010

authorAffiliation.value: Federal University of Rio de Janeiro

datasetContactAffiliation.value: Federal University of Rio de Janeiro

dsDescriptionValue.value: This is the underlying social data extracted from the 2010 Brazil census. The data were limited to the Metropolitan Region of Rio de Janeiro (MRRJ) under a specific geographic partitioning: sub-districts on the capital, and municipalities in other. The attributes were chosen based on the United Nations social indicators. Please see: http://unstats.un.org/unsd/demographic/products/socind/.

fields.value:
The original data were made public by the official Brazilian census. We just chose some attributes and aggregate it in order to fit in a specific geographic partitioning.
The first two columns in each data set are the key columns, that can be used to join the layers: census_code (the ID of the region, it may be a city or a sub-district, the shorter number is for a city); city_or_subdistrict (the name of the region).

otherGeographicCoverage.value: All cities in the Metropolitan Region of Rio de Janeiro

files.description:
Basic education data, as follows:
number of adults that can read and write,
number of youngs that can read and write,
men with no education / incomplete primary education,
women with no education / incomplete primary education,
men with primary / incomplete secondary education,
women with primary / incomplete secondary education,
men with high school / incomplete undergraduate,
women with high school / incomplete undergraduate,
men with undergraduate degree completed,
women with undergraduate degree completed,
men with unknown education,
women with unknown education.
files.label: education.tab

men with high school / incomplete undergraduate,
women with high school / incomplete undergraduate,

women with undergraduate degree completed,
men with unknown education,
women with unknown education.

files.description:
Generic deceased data, as follows:
men deceased above 5 years old,
women deceased above 5 years old,
child deceased bellow or equal to 5 years old.
files.label: health.tab

dataFile.description:
Generic deceased data, as follows:
men deceased above 5 years old,
women deceased above 5 years old,

files.description:
Basic housing data, water supply and sewage data, as follows:
average of dormitories per housing unit,
number of housing units with water in the property, but outside the house,
number of housing units with no water,
number of housing units with water water inside the house,
number of housing units whose bathroom/toilet drain is connected to a ditch,
number of housing units whose bathroom/toilet drain is connected to a sceptic tank,
number of housing units whose bathroom/toilet drain is connected to a rudimentary sceptic tank,
number of housing units whose bathroom/toilet drain is connected to a river, lake or ocean,
number of housing units whose bathroom/toilet drain is connected to a public sewage network.
files.label: housing.tab

dataFile.description:
Basic housing data, water supply and sewage data, as follows:
average of dormitories per housing unit,
number of housing units with water in the property, but outside the house,
number of housing units with no water,
number of housing units with water water inside the house,
number of housing units whose bathroom/toilet drain is connected to a ditch,
number of housing units whose bathroom/toilet drain is connected to a sceptic tank,
number of housing units whose bathroom/toilet drain is connected to a rudimentary sceptic tank,
number of housing units whose bathroom/toilet drain is connected to a river, lake or ocean,
number of housing units whose bathroom/toilet drain is connected to a public sewage network.

files.description: A study area bounded by the Brazilian cell phone area code 21, which includes the Metropolitan Region of Rio de Janeiro, the 2nd larger metropolitan region in Brazil. This shape file may be used to join with the other layers by the "census_code" column. There is a specific geographic partitioning on this; given the larger size, the capital was divided by sub-districts.
files.label: MRRJ_21_area_census.zip

dataFile.description: A study area bounded by the Brazilian cell phone area code 21, which includes the Metropolitan Region of Rio de Janeiro, the 2nd larger metropolitan region in Brazil. This shape file may be used to join with the other layers by the "census_code" column. There is a specific geographic partitioning on this; given the larger size, the capital was divided by sub-districts.

files.description:
Generic population data, as follows:
the whole population of the region,
percentage of men,
percentage of women,
how many women counts for a 100 men (both above 15)?,
percentage of population above 15,
how many men counts for a 100 women (both above 60)?,
percentage of population above 60,
percentage of residents who declared their color or race as white,
percentage of residents who declared their color or race as black,
percentage of residents who declared their color or race as yellow (Asian),
percentage of residents who declared their color or race as brown (Brazilian mulatto),
percentage of residents who declared their color or race as indigenous.
files.label: population.tab

dataFile.description:
Generic population data, as follows:
the whole population of the region,
percentage of men,
percentage of women,
how many women counts for a 100 men (both above 15)?,
percentage of population above 15,
how many men counts for a 100 women (both above 60)?,
percentage of population above 60,
percentage of residents who declared their color or race as white,
percentage of residents who declared their color or race as black,
percentage of residents who declared their color or race as yellow (Asian),
percentage of residents who declared their color or race as brown (Brazilian mulatto),
percentage of residents who declared their color or race as indigenous.

files.description:
Basic mobility data related to work commuting, as follows,
percentage of residents aged 10 years or older who: work in their own home,
work in their municipality but not in own home,
 work in another municipality,
 who work in a foreign country,
 who take up to 5 minutes commuting to work,
who take from 6 minutes to half an hour commuting to work,
who take from half an hour to an hour commuting to work,
who take more than one hour to two hours commuting to work,
who take more than 2 hours commuting to work, return home from work every day.
files.label: work_mobility.tab

dataFile.description:

who take more than 2 hours commuting to work, return home from work every day.

files.description:
Basic economic data, as follows:
total montly income by man (average),
total montly income by woman (average),
housing unit per capita,
number of men employed,
number of women employed,
number of men employee,
number of women employee.
files.label: work.tab
